turn.2: P. H. Welshimer Pearl Howard "P. H." Welshimer (April 6, 1873 – August 16, 1957) was an American Christian minister and author from Canton, Ohio and well-known leader in the Restoration Movement.
turn.3: What did you find most interesting about the article?
turn.4: Pearl Welshimer was born to Samuel and Louisa Jane Wilson Welshimer at Union Center, Union County, Ohio, on April 6, 1873.
turn.6: As a boy he selected for himself the middle name “Howard.” In his adult years he was most often known simply as “P.H.”  Welshimer graduated from Ohio Northern University at Ada in 1894.
turn.7: What did he study at university?
turn.8: In his final year of school there, university president Henry Lehr pulled Welshimer aside and urged him to abandon the study of law for the ministry.
turn.10: As a result, Welshimer attended Hiram College to study preaching.
turn.12: After graduating from Hiram in 1897, Welshimer accepted a call to a church in Millersburg, Ohio.
